plotter3d module

Provides functions for 3D plotting.

plotter3d.convert_to_png(src: ndarray) → ndarray

Converts an image to PNG format with an alpha channel.

Parameters:

src (np.ndarray) – Input image.

Returns:

Converted image in PNG format with an alpha channel.

Return type:

np.ndarray

plotter3d.create_3d_image(src: str, dst: str, color: bool = False, img_scale: int = 2) → None

Create a 3D image plot using a series of images.

Parameters:

  • src (str) – Directory path containing the input images.

  • dst (str) – Name of the output HTML file.

  • color (intcla) – Optional, whether to plot the image in color. Defaults to False.

  • img_scale – Optional, whether to plot the image in color. Defaults to False.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

plotter3d.interpolate(p_from: ndarray, p_to: ndarray, num: int) → ndarray

Interpolates between two points in 3D space.

Parameters:

  • p_from (np.ndarray) – Starting point in 3D space.

  • p_to (np.ndarray) – Ending point in 3D space.

  • num (int) – Number of points to interpolate between p_from and p_to.

Returns:

An array of interpolated points between p_from and p_to.

Return type:

np.ndarray

plotter3d.plotImage(ply: Figure, img: ndarray, z_index: float, size: ndarray = array([1, 1]), img_scale: int = 2, color: bool = False) → None

Plot an image on a 3D plot.

Parameters:

  • ply (plotly.graph_objects.Figure) – Plotly figure object to add the image to.

  • img (np.ndarray) – Image to plot.

  • index (float) – Z-index of the image.

  • size (np.ndarray) – Optional, size of the image in the plot. Defaults to np.array((1, 1)).

  • img_scale (int) – Optional, scale factor to resize the image. Defaults to 2.

  • color (bool) – Optional, whether to plot the image in color. Defaults to False.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
